concept.title: Log collection improvement
concept.shortdesc: Log collection improvement feature is used to avoid MME instability or performance issue caused by the large amount of logs when the enabled log level is not the default one in load scenarios.

conbody.p: The log collection improvement feature provides two mechanism through which the log output can be under control while enough logging information is provided to troubleshoot various scenarios:

ul.li: The log level can be defined per class, instead of the whole process. And the additional filters based on subscriber IDs can be added. For example: operator can change the log level to trace level for the whole paging procedure classes for a specific IMSI.
The log collection improvement feature can be automatically disabled in case the source consumption reaches a certain limit. This limit is configured in the LNX924NX.INI and LNX934NX.INI files.

conbody.p: The log collection improvement feature only supports paging and service request procedures.
